page.title: 06ODSTOCK HOSPITAL,SALISBURY
page.content: Built 1945 by American Air Force. Odstock has 410 beds and regional units in Wessex for spinal injuries, plastic surgery, burns and rehabilitation. Other units are Maternity,Gynaecology, Orthopaedics, Handicapped children, Geriatrics and Special Care Babies.Odstock deals with 120,000 outpatients a year & 17,524 admissions. Employs 693 nurses, and 205 students, 51 specialists and 300 catering staff.The oldest ward is Harnwood ward, one of the original Nissan Huts to be demolished soon as a new District Hospital is built. Housing for nurses & doctors. For patients: a Community centre, swimming pool, two tennis courts, a school for handicapped children which has 23 pupils; and a Douglas Arter Centre run by the Spastics Society, not the Health Authority.
